item.title: What the referendum can achieve

item.title: Textile waste management
item.description: TEXTILE and apparel production are central to Bangladesh’s economic success. item.title: Legal gaps undermining child protection
item.description: THE effectiveness of labour legislation rests not only on its intent but on the clarity and internal coherence of its definitions. In Bangladesh, the regulatory framework governing child labour under the Bangladesh Labour Act 2006 is weakened by persistent age-related ambiguities and structural contradictions. These inconsistencies dilute institutional accountability......

item.title: Scripture, interpretation and female authority

item.title: Persistent private sector credit decline alarming
item.description: A PERSISTENT decline in private-sector credit flow has for months been weighing on the economy, with the authorities yet to take any effective measures to reverse the trend. Private-sector credit growth, as the Bangladesh Bank says, fell to 6.1 per cent in December 2025, the lowest in more than two decades. Such a sluggish growth has a damaging impact on industrial......
